posts.title: Artist Interview: Ellen Hackl Fagan
posts.text: "My work is not about saying anything, it's about feeling something, getting immersed in looking at the fine details, losing ones' place in the familiar world, entering the world of imagining."

posts.title: Artist Interview with Takashi Harada
posts.text: "Don’t stop. Don’t jump off from the art train. We artists are all on the fast running art train. Once you decide to jump off from it, you’ll never be able to come back."

posts.title: Artist Interview with Jacob Paiz
posts.text: Jacob Paiz is an Alaskan artist who grew up in Anchorage. He specializes in fine art and digital design.

posts.title: Artist Interview with Renee Hunt
posts.text: "Libraries hold a special place in my heart because they were where I would go to create digital paintings before I was able to land a job. Looking through the books there would provide me with inspiration. Also, I loved libraries for the people-watching opportunities."

posts.title: Artist Interview: Gregory Coutinho
posts.text: "I don't know that I'll ever feel like I've fully mastered painting or any other medium, but when I catch glimpses of it in the zone, during that rare effortless balance between technique and what I'll call, say, "blissflow," I'm shown that the reason I do this is for those moments."

posts.title: Artist Interview: Alison Cuomo
posts.text: "Nature stuns me, unfathomably immense. I am constantly learning from it. Each painting becomes a landscape that I inhabit."

posts.title: Artist Interview: Sharon Norwood
posts.text: "My work is meant to provoke an honest conversation about race and difference. In the best of worlds I imagine my work engaging with the viewer in an intimate way. Reminding them of self and sparking a conversation, an interrogation, questioning."

posts.title: Artist Interview with Yael Ben-Zion
posts.text: "When I work on a project or a single image, lines and scenes from books often float at the back of my head."

posts.title: Interview with Cartoonist Gabrielle Bell
posts.text: Bell, a New York City-based cartoonist, is frequently included in the 'Best American Comics' anthologies and several of her books are available in NYPL's collection.

posts.title: Interview with Artist William Augel
posts.text: French draftsman and illustrator, Augel is the author of several books for children including the comic book 'Young Mozart.'

posts.title: Interview with Artist Amy Kurzweil
posts.text: A cartoonist and writer, she talks about her influences, her work and her career (she submitted over 100 cartoons to the New Yorker before having one published!).

posts.title: An Interview with Textile Artist William Daniels
posts.text: An interview about the themes of his work, his process and the impact of the pandemic on his life and work.

posts.title: Interview with Artist Imani Shanklin Roberts
posts.text: She describes herself as an "artist and enthused educator who peels apart topics on race, gender, and identity."

posts.title: Interview with Artist Johnny Quan
posts.text: "I think art, all art, is the exploration and expression of being, and an exercise of discipline. It's a representation of the individual human experience and possibilities for the future. Without art, life would be empty"

posts.title: Interview with Artist Marie Trope Zanzal
posts.text: "Asking an artist 'Why art?' is like asking a fish 'Why water?' It is not a choice."
